Sentencas: This paper presents the results of an experimental investigation of transient characterizations of 300 W planar type Solid Oxide Fuel Cell (SOFC) cell stack during load change.
Titulo: The effect of overpotentials on the transient response of the 300 W SOFC cell stack voltage

Sentencas: It indicates the transient characterization obtained during a ramped electric current with a Current-Based Fuel Control (CBFC) strategy.
Titulo: The effect of overpotentials on the transient response of the 300 W SOFC cell stack voltage

Sentencas: The fuel utilization factor is chosen for a reference of the CBFC strategy and is kept constant to the ramping electric current.
Titulo: The effect of overpotentials on the transient response of the 300 W SOFC cell stack voltage

Sentencas: The fuel utilization factor can be described as a ratio of consumed fuel (expressed as a function with an applied electric current) to supplied fuel.
Titulo: The effect of overpotentials on the transient response of the 300 W SOFC cell stack voltage

Sentencas: For the simplification of discussion, hydrogen was used as fuel by mixing it with nitrogen in order to satisfy the constant gas residential time in all cases and instances.
Titulo: The effect of overpotentials on the transient response of the 300 W SOFC cell stack voltage

Sentencas: The transient response of the cell voltage obtained under several thermal conditions was shown for discussion.
Titulo: The effect of overpotentials on the transient response of the 300 W SOFC cell stack voltage

Sentencas: The effect of overpotentials, associated with the cell's operating temperature, on the transient response of the cell voltage is primarily discussed.
Titulo: The effect of overpotentials on the transient response of the 300 W SOFC cell stack voltage

Sentencas: The paper indicates that reducing the fuel flow rate, namely, setting a higher set-point for the fuel utilization factor, may decrease the OCV, increase concentration polarization and finally degrade cell performance.
Titulo: The effect of overpotentials on the transient response of the 300 W SOFC cell stack voltage

Sentencas: This paper also pointed out the importance of operating temperature management on both improving the steady-state cell performance and eliminating the negative effect of the overpotentials that appear on the transient response of the cell voltage.
Titulo: The effect of overpotentials on the transient response of the 300 W SOFC cell stack voltage
